It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside of its native habitat.
